newsitem.title: TURKEY: Bomb found on Turkish army site kills child.
newsitem.headline: Bomb found on Turkish army site kills child.

text.p: One child was killed and four were hurt when a bomb they found on an army shooting range in Turkey's eastern province of Erzurum exploded, security officials said on Thursday.
"One child was killed, another four were injured as a bomb went off," a security official told Reuters on phone. He gave no further details.

The state-run Anatolian news agency said children had found a bomb in an army shooting range near their house in the township of Pasinler and took it home, where it exploded. Details about the bomb were not available.
Four-year-old Fedia Ogurce died at the blast and four other children in the family, aged between six and 12, were badly injured and taken to hospital.
Anatolian said security officials had begun to search houses in the township on rumours that other children had picked up bombs from the shooting range.
Turkey's third army corps is based near Erzurum and troops from the province sometimes join the fight against rebel Kurds in the nearby southeast of Turkey.
More than 22,000 people have been killed in over 12 years of fighting between government troops and guerrillas of the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) seeking self-rule in the mainly Kurdish southeast.
